economico

Class EconomicController

  • java.lang.Object
    • economico.EconomicController

  • @RestController
public class EconomicController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class define the controller and contains the request mapping in order to use as a restful server.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Fernando

    • Method Detail

      • getCountry

        @CrossOrigin(origins="*")
 @RequestMapping(value="/getCountry")
public java.util.ArrayList<Country> getCountry()
        This method gets the countries information by CountryDao object.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList parameterized with Country that allows to Google convert the ArrayList into a JSON.

      • getCountry

        public Country getCountry(java.lang.String countryCode)
        This method get the Country name by the code.
        Parameters:
        countryCode - The Country code.
        Returns:
        Country class which contains the country name and code.

      • getIndicator

        @CrossOrigin(origins="*")
 @RequestMapping(value="/getIndicator")
public java.util.ArrayList<Indicator> getIndicator()
        This method gets the indicators information by IndicatorDao object.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList parameterized with Indicator that allows to Google convert the ArrayList into a JSON

      • getDataBank

        @CrossOrigin(origins="*")
 @RequestMapping(value="/getDataBank")
public java.util.ArrayList<Result> getDataBank(@RequestParam(value="indicator",defaultValue="BG.GSR.NFSV.GD.ZS")
                                                                                                                  java.lang.String indicator,
                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="minValue",defaultValue="1960")
                                                                                                                  java.lang.Integer minValue,
                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="maxValue",defaultValue="2016")
                                                                                                                  java.lang.Integer maxValue,
                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="countries",defaultValue="MEX")
                                                                                                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> countries)
        This method gets the data using the indicator, minValue, maxValue and countries like a filter between the data and the requested data.
        Parameters:
        indicator - Indicator code used to filter the data. If doesn't exists into the request, uses as default value "BG.GSR.NFSV.GD.ZS".
        minValue - Initial year used to filter the data. If doesn't exists into the request, uses as default value "1960".
        maxValue - Final year used to filter the data. If doesn't exists into the request, uses as default value "2016".
        countries - ArrayList parameterized with String which contains the country or countries required to filter the data. If doesn't exists into the request, uses as default value "MEX".
        Returns:
        An ArrayList parameterized with Result class that allows to Google convert the Map into a JSON.
